hiqfermion.ansatzes package¶

Submodules¶

hiqfermion.ansatzes.ansatz_quccsd module¶

class hiqfermion.ansatzes.ansatz_quccsd.Q_UCCSD¶

Bases: object

Create a fermionic operator that is the generator of Q_UCCSD. This is a straightforward while not efficient method to generate the Q_UCCSD ansatz.

# this module is to generate the unitary coupled cluster single and double excitations. # the idea is come from the arxiv paper https://doi.org/10.1103/PhysRevA.98.022322.

static down_index(index, beta)¶

Return the index of spin down electron, here the down_index begin with the boundary of half number of electrons

generator(single_amplitudes, double_amplitudes)¶

“Return the uccsd generator by first generating single excitations and then generating the double excitations. Args:

The single_amplitudes and double_amplitudes are the list
get_packed_amplitudes(single_amplitudes, double_amplitudes, n_qubits, n_electrons)¶

Convert amplitudes for use with Q_UCCSD

The output list contains only those amplitudes that are relevant to Q_UCCSD, in an order suitable for use with the function Q_UCCSD.generator.

Args:
single_amplitudes(ndarray): [N x N] array storing single excitation
amplitudes corresponding to t[i,j] * (a_i^dagger a_j - H.C.)
double_amplitudes(ndarray): [N x N x N x N] array storing double
excitation amplitudes corresponding to t[i,j,k,l] * (a_i^dagger a_j a_k^dagger a_l - H.C.)
n_qubits(int): Number of spin-orbitals used to represent the system,
which also corresponds to number of qubits in a non-compact map.

n_electrons(int): Number of electrons in the physical system.

Returns:
packed_amplitudes(list): List storing the unique single
and double excitation amplitudes for a singlet UCCSD operator. The ordering lists unique single excitations before double excitations.
q_uccsd_convert_amplitude_format(single_amplitudes, double_amplitudes)¶

Re-format single_amplitudes and double_amplitudes from ndarrays to lists, basically to allocate the corresponding index to the value.

signlet_generator(packed_amplitudes, n_qubits, n_electrons)¶

Create a singlet Q_UCCSD generator for a system with n_electrons

This function generates a FermionOperator for a Q_UCCSD generator designed
to act on a reference state (Hartree Fock state) consisting of n_qubits spin orbitals and n_electrons electrons. The initial state is usually a Hartree Fock state.
Args:
packed_amplitudes(list): List storing the unique single
and double excitation amplitudes for a singlet Q_UCCSD operator. The ordering lists unique single excitations before double excitations.
n_qubits(int): Number of spin-orbitals used to represent the system,
which also corresponds to number of qubits in a non-compact map.

n_electrons(int): Number of electrons in the physical system.

Returns:
generator(FermionOperator): Generator of the Q_UCCSD operator that
builds the Q_UCCSD wavefunction.
singlet_param_size(n_qubits, n_electrons)¶

Determine number of independent amplitudes for Q_UCCSD

Args:
n_qubits(int): Number of qubits/spin-orbitals in the system n_electrons(int): Number of electrons in the reference state
Returns:
Number of independent parameters for Q_UCCSD with a reference state(generally should be Hartree Fock state).
static up_index(index)¶

Return the index of spin up electron

hiqfermion.ansatzes.ansatz_rxrz module¶

class hiqfermion.ansatzes.ansatz_rxrz.AnsatzRxRz(n_qubits, depth=1, entangle_mapping='full', initial_state=None)¶

Bases: hiqfermion.ansatzes.variational_ansatz.VariationalAnsatz

Layers of Rx, Rz rotations followed by entanglement gates. Arguments:

Variational_Ansatz – generate the variational ansatz
build_ansatz(params, eng)¶

Construct the variational ansatz

Arguments:

params (numpy.ndarray[float]) – parameters for the ansatz

eng (simulator engine) – a compiler engine

qureg (quantum register) – quantum register for the ansatz (default: {None})

Returns:
Quantum ansatz state: an ansatz state with given parameters
Raises:
The length of params is not matched the number of parameters (self._n_parameters)

hiqfermion.ansatzes.ansatz_ry module¶

This module is to implement a specific ansatz with Ry rotation followed by the entanglement operation
